statements.select:
SELECT ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY AA.ID) AS RowNo , AA.ID , AA.CreateDate , AA.CreateBy , AA.CreateByName , AA.UpdateDate , AA.UpdateBy , AA.UpdateByName
, AA.BrandID , AA.StartDate , AA.EndDate , AA.EmployeeID
, EE.EmplyeeNo , EE.EmployeeName , EE.UseYn , EE.PersonID
, BB.PersonType , BB.PersonName , BB.EngName , BB.Email , BB.PhoneNo1 , BB.PhoneNo2 , BB.FaxNo , BB.ImageUrl
FROM dbo.BMBrandManager AA WITH (NOLOCK) INNER JOIN dbo.BCEmployee EE WITH (NOLOCK) ON AA.EmployeeID = EE.ID INNER JOIN dbo.BMPerson BB WITH (NOLOCK) ON EE.PersonID = BB.ID WHERE AA.BrandID = #BrandID# ORDER BY RowNo

SELECT AA.ID , AA.CreateDate , AA.CreateBy , AA.CreateByName , AA.UpdateDate , AA.UpdateBy , AA.UpdateByName
, AA.BrandID , AA.EmployeeID , AA.StartDate , AA.EndDate
FROM dbo.BMBrandManager AA WITH (NOLOCK) WHERE AA.ID = #ID#
statements.insert:
INSERT INTO dbo.BMBrandManager ( CreateDate, CreateBy, CreateByName, BrandID, EmployeeID, StartDate, EndDate ) VALUES ( GetDate(), #CreateBy#, #CreateByName#, #BrandID#, #EmployeeID#, #StartDate#, #EndDate# )
SELECT @@IDENTITY AS ID
statements.update:
UPDATE dbo.BMBrandManager SET UpdateDate = GetDate() , UpdateBy = #UpdateBy# , UpdateByName = #UpdateByName#
, EmployeeID = #EmployeeID# , StartDate = #StartDate# , EndDate = #EndDate# WHERE ID = #ID#
